column1: Always wonderful to join @NCNWHQ for their annual MLK breakfast event here in Louisville. A great group working to honor the life and legacy of a great man. https://t.co/1V12jTd44p
You should read this. https://t.co/LxQy2d7Orb

Thinking of my hero Louisville’s own @MuhammadAli on what would be his 78th birthday today. Thankful for the @AliCenter and grateful for their dedication to promoting Muhammad’s six core principles: confidence conviction dedication respect giving and spirituality. #GOAT https://t.co/MIghBxjEdG
Proud of the work @raiseRED_UofL continues to do on and off campus! #GoCards #FTK https://t.co/a7gmq2mcJb

Thank you Chairman @BobbyScott and @EdLaborCmte members for successfully marking up my bill the Runaway and Homeless Youth & Trafficking Prevention Act today. Congress must #PassRHYTPA to help protect & provide support services to our at-risk youth and young adult population.

Finally some good news out of Washington. If you paid even passing attention to the news of the past few years that probably sounds like the setup to a joke. But it’s true. I actually come bearing a tale of this government working as it should. https://t.co/Ww0KAde3OK

Article I of the Constitution gives Congress the responsibility to declare war and I am unwilling to send any of our men and women in uniform into harm’s way on the orders of an impulsive and unstable President.
I am heading to the House floor now to vote in favor of a War Powers Resolution limiting President Trump’s ability to enter us into another uncertain endless war this time with Iran.

Nine years later I remain in awe of my friend @GabbyGiffords’ tenacity her dedication and her courage in the fight for common sense reforms to our nation’s gun laws. I’m proud to stand with her in this fight today and always. https://t.co/zjfhjLIbEJ

Iran was abiding by the JCPOA—which explicitly states they can never obtain a nuclear weapon on its third line—as fully confirmed by international inspectors and your own State Department. You blew it when you blew up that agreement. https://t.co/vZbyOK4oIX https://t.co/4f86V6pLqn

The revitalization of Beecher Terrace is key to helping bridge the Ninth Street Divide and I’m glad that local residents have been on the front lines of this initiative to reimagine and reinvest in one of the most historically and culturally rich parts of our city.

Our city has been a national model for the success of @HUDgov’s Choice Neighborhoods & HOPE VI programs and this investment is a sign of the progress being made to improve not just housing but also provide better infrastructure schools & services to West Louisville residents. https://t.co/FXrgHQGJcc

Ending this egregious offset is a momentous victory for the more than 60000 surviving spouses and families of our nation’s fallen heroes. #AxeWidowsTax  https://t.co/QWmm8Rd6SW https://t.co/oozs7n0MLJ

Another outstanding #VeteransDay Parade here in Louisville. Proud to represent such a thankful city honoring all who have served. https://t.co/kSoIMkN1QC

Today we honor those who have sacrificed their sweat and blood so we may all live free and we vow to be there for our veterans and active duty service members when THEY need US not just when we need them.

We’re blessed to live in the greatest and most free country in the world but that freedom has a cost. We must honor the sacrifices of our veterans by fighting back when anyone foreign or domestic threatens the freedoms they defended.

Our veterans shouldn’t have to fight to get quality health care job training a roof over their head or an education they are owed. They and their families shouldn’t have to fight to find adequate mental health services for PTSD and the other less visible wounds of war.

As we join together in thanks and appreciation of the brave men and women who’ve fought around the world to protect this nation today let’s also commit to ensuring they won’t have to struggle here at home to build a strong future.
Joined @jolingkent on @MSNBC this morning to discuss the latest in the impeachment inquiry and @HouseDemocrats' work to defend our democracy. Watch here: https://t.co/uVwCS9vcs4

Among the projects on President Trump’s chopping block: $62M in funding that was headed to Fort Campbell for a new middle school to help with overcrowded classrooms. The president’s obsession with his dumb wall is hurting Kentucky military families. https://t.co/HLjBsdFwTV

This reckless action not only steals funding from our military to build an ineffective wall (that the President promised Mexico would pay for) it also violates the separation of powers and Congress’s Constitutional power of the purse. We will fight back. https://t.co/ZryE78h6QD
There’s plenty more that can be done to care for our nation’s workers but today we honor the blood sweat and dedication of all of the working men and women who came before us.

From our factory floors to our farm lands American workers have stood up to protect one another secure the 40-hour work week and a safe retirement and provide so many with the strength that comes with unionization.
Labor Day serves as a reminder of the hard work and sacrifices made by so many throughout our nation’s history in the fight for workers’ rights.

No finer way to celebrate the abundance of culture and compassion here in Louisville than our annual WorldFest parade and festival. So glad to join @louisvillemayor and thousands more in honor of what truly makes America great—our rich diversity. https://t.co/JHZfEYH0Zl

Mr. President: Louisville is a compassionate and welcoming city so we will welcome you today. But please know that many of us here stand in defiance of and in opposition to the vile hate-filled speech you use every day to divide and distract our nation. Enjoy your visit.

Yesterday sitting in the Oval Office the President questioned my intelligence faith and loyalty to this country—along with the intelligence faith and loyalty of all Jewish Democrats in America.  Today he lands in the city I’ve called home since the day I was born.

I remember when the only times you’d hear a president say something this bigoted against an entire group of Americans was when secret recordings leaked from the Oval Office. For this president bigotry and hate aren’t taboo. They’re his favorite weapons. https://t.co/2jxT4vqQTX

The House has acted and would do more. But President Trump and Mitch McConnell are AWOL. Moms demand action as do dads and children and brothers and sisters. Where is our leadership?
The first responsibility of government is to protect its citizens. The Congress just authorized $738 billion for the defense department but has taken no action to prevent gun violence.

Unspeakable acts of terror and violence in Ohio and Texas in the last 24 hrs. I was just in El Paso on Friday and can’t even begin to convey the level of appreciation and sympathy I have for the wonderful people in that community.

Our #DemsAtTheBorder delegation met with immigration advocates this morning and took part in a binational trade roundtable. Now walking over to conduct oversight of an ORR facility for unaccompanied children. No cell phones or photos permitted but will update as best I can. https://t.co/bRiaGTrecN

We’re now touring the Paso del Norte Bridge & port of entry with officials from CBP’s Field Operations team. One interesting piece of information: only 2-4% of asylum claims are approved in this area. In other ports of entry like Baltimore or NY 35-40% are approved. https://t.co/FSoDcCeGS9

On the ground in Ciudad Juárez to see first-hand the conditions along the border. Meeting with CBP and immigration advocates touring processing facilities & the port of entry and speaking directly with those seeking asylum & safety in the U.S. Will give updates as best I can. https://t.co/B8F0UcMlzm

Republicans were slick in trying to distract us but the facts are clear.  The president is a criminal bent on deceiving the American public. All else is smoke and mirrors. [3/3]

➡️ Mueller did NOT exonerate Trump. After 4 months of "no collusion no obstruction" this is a proven LIE by Trump/Republicans.  ➡️ Trump and his associates tried on multiple occasions to obstruct and derail investigations into his corruption — a CRIME. [2/3]

Don't let the theatrics distract from what we saw yesterday which confirmed without question:  ➡️ Russia attacked and continues to attack our elections to help Trump. He welcomes their ILLEGAL help. [1/3]

Since the president's horrifically racist tweets there's been a lot less talk about his detention camps and persecution of immigrant families. It's not a coincidence. He uses vile words to distract from vile acts. We mustn't look away.
Looking forward to the day our nation is no longer led by this racist ignorant hate-mongering wannabe dictator.

That three of the four women he’s debasing were born in the U.S. is beside the point. The point is sowing and exploiting racist hate and he has again taken his strategy to a disgusting new level that every American must reject.

“Go back where you came from” the cry of every bigoted tyrant for centuries. As a Jewish American whose ancestors scattered the globe and never by choice the words and sentiment are all too familiar. https://t.co/lh4M8Ph3g2

Grateful that @HASCDemocrats and @RulesDemocrats included my amendment with @RepJoeWilson to once and for all repeal the SBP-DIC offset in the NDAA rule. I’m headed down to the floor now to discuss just how important it is that we #AxeWidowsTax.
